## Why R ?

 - `R` is open source and free
 - `R` great community and around 12000 packages (add-ons)


---
## Open an Excel sheet 

```{r}
library(readxl)
data <- read_excel(path = "data/data.xlsx", sheet = 1)
data
```	

---
## Grammar of data manipulation and graphics


```{r}
library(dplyr)
data %>%
  filter(village == "B") 
```

---
## Grammar of data manipulation

```{r}
data %>%
  filter(village == "B", taille > 170)
```

---
## Grammar of data manipulation

```{r}
data %>%
  arrange(poids)
```

---
## Grammar of data manipulation

```{r}
data %>%
  arrange(desc(poids))
```

---
## Grammar of data manipulation

```{r}
data %>%
  select(nom, taille)
```
---
## Grammar of data manipulation

```{r}
data %>%
  select(nom, taille) %>%
  arrange(desc(taille))
```

---
## Grammar of data manipulation

```{r}
data %>%
  mutate(taille_metre = taille / 100,
         imc = poids / (taille_metre^2)) %>%
  arrange(desc(imc))
```

---
## Grammaire of graphics
- Grammaire similaire pour faire des graphiques `ggplot2`
- Manipulation des données spatiales `sf`
- D'autres aspects (enquêtes complexes, modélisation, etc)
